Skills

Intermediate Rails Developer

Over the past three years I have worked on a number of Rails applications, both professionally and side projects. Through my experience I've become familiar with API development, Heroku, Ember.js, TDD, RabbitMQ, continuous integration, web scraping, tools for authentication, WordPress, front end frameworks like bootstrap, and version control. I know the entire Rails stack and can be productive with any type of feature development.

Committed to self-improvement

Investing in myself is a high priority for me. I continuously self-assess areas I can improve my knowledge and programming skills, and then create and implement strategies to address these areas. I enjoy taking on extra projects to try out new technologies. I am very driven to become a highly skilled web developer.

Team player with solo experience

I'm collaborative by nature, so I thrive in a team environment. I get a lot of enjoyment from working with others. I have an upbeat attitude even in the face of adversity, and I consistently make an effort to focus on the positive. Helping to create a fun, collaborative environment is important to me, so I'm not interested in drama, gossip, or backbiting. I love to learn, so being able to glean from the experience and knowledge of others is very appealing. I'm also able to be self-directed, having worked on several projects with minimal or no oversight.
